item.title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate as Three Lions advance to semi-finals
item.description: Fans react as England beat Ukraine 4-0 to reach Euro 2020 semi-final.

item.title: Euro 2020: England win over Ukraine most-watched live TV event of the year with 20.9m peak
item.description: England's 4-0 victory over Ukraine at Euro 2020 attracts a peak TV audience of 20.9m, making it the most-watched live TV event of the year with 81.8% audience share.

item.title: Covid-19: Masks will become personal choice, says Robert Jenrick
item.description: England will move into a period without legal restrictions as measures ease, Robert Jenrick says.

item.title: Homeowners to get 15 years to sue for bad workmanship - minister
item.description: The announcement comes amid concerns leaseholders are bearing the cost of fire safety works.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Compelling' health argument for easing lockdown, and retail abuse warnings
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.

item.title: Philippines military plane crash kills at least 17 but many survive
item.description: Some 40 of those on board are pulled from the burning wreckage on the southern island of Jolo.

item.title: Miami building collapse: Search efforts suspended ahead of demolition
item.description: Teams are preparing to raze the standing portion of an apartment building that collapsed last week.

item.title: Prince Charles reveals favourite songs in radio show to thank volunteers
item.description: The future king highlights one 1970s pop hit which gave him "an irresistible urge to dance".

item.title: Cyprus appeals for help as deadly wildfire rips through forest
item.description: Four missing people are confirmed dead as a huge blaze forces the evacuation of several villages.

item.title: Don't allow shop abuse to worsen, retail bosses urge PM
item.description: Retailers say the situation got worse during the pandemic and they want better legal protection for workers.

item.title: How cattle are helping rare butterflies to thrive at Mabie Forest
item.description: Pearl-bordered fritillary numbers are rising at one site - with some unusual assistance.

item.title: Memorial for Sgt Matiu Ratana: Rugby club's unsung hero
item.description: Sgt Matiu Ratana, head coach at East Grinstead Rugby Club, was "a role model, mentor and friend".

item.title: The Papers: Mask laws 'to be axed', and 'Lions roar in Rome'
item.description: Sunday's papers look ahead to lockdown lifting in England on 19 July, and celebrate the football win.

item.title: Portal: Lithuania and Poland build a window connecting two cities
item.description: Residents of Vilnius, Lithuania and Lublin, Poland are now connected by a 'portal' between the cities.

item.title: Israeli videographer goes viral with sheep drone shots
item.description: Lior Patel's drone footage of sheep has been viewed more than 100,000 times on Facebook.

item.title: What we can all learn from Britney Spears’ case
item.description: The pop star’s conservatorship has shed light on our treatment of female celebrities in the 2000s.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'animal crossing'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Norfolk seal inscription mystery solved by US man on Twitter
item.description: Alex Cortez from California says he used a free morning to research a silver seal found in Norfolk.

item.title: Belfast murals: Dan Kitchener street graffiti inspired by Japanese art
item.description: A renowned street artist explains the Japanese-inspired mural he's created in Belfast.

item.title: Week in pictures: 26 June - 2 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: How dogs are helping the Surfside rescue effort
item.description: From trauma therapy to search and rescue, these dogs are playing a pivotal role in recovery

item.title: The cat with more than 50,000 social media followers
item.description: Pet influencers have become the latest social media stars with the pandemic fuelling content demand.

item.title: Covid: Stars perform musical song in latest vaccine push
item.description: Film, TV and stage actors appear in a campaign video urging people to get their Covid jab.

item.title: 'I used drugs every day in lockdown, but now I'm drug-free'
item.description: Lee says he went from using drugs once a week to every day during the lockdown - but now he's in recovery.

item.title: 'Hiking as a black person in the US can be nerve-racking'
item.description: Mardi is part of Outdoor Afro, an organisation which encourages black nature lovers into the outdoors.

item.title: Can esports be more inclusive and accessible for people with disabilities?
item.description: A pilot event has taken place to work out how competitive gaming can include more people.

item.title: Archaeologists dig in over planning reforms row
item.description: Experts warn history and heritage could be lost if they are excluded from the government's new plans.

item.title: Pandemic investing: 'Using my part-time pay to invest in stocks'
item.description: Interest in investing and trading grew during the Covid pandemic, but experts warn of the risks.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu's arrest leaves Nigeria's Ipob separatists in disarray
item.description: Igbo separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu was largely ignored until his movement became an armed struggle.

item.title: Miami condo collapse: A boom, then the ground shook
item.description: Witnesses recount the terrifying night of the Champlain Tower collapse and the week that shook Miami.

item.title: 'Coercion and rape': Investigating my yoga school
item.description: Ishleen Kaur was passionate about yoga movement Sivananda, until she found allegations of sexual abuse.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Andy Murray on losing to Denis Shapovalov
item.description: Andy Murray says he needs to weigh up "if all the hard work is worth it" after an encouraging run at Wimbledon is ended by Canada's Denis Shapovalov.

item.title: Then and now: Arctic sea-ice feeling the heat
item.description: As Arctic sea-ice melts in a warming world, it causes the world to heat more rapidly.

item.title: Meet Tai Verdes, the rising star who funded his career by winning a dating show
item.description: Tai Verdes didn't know how to make it in the music industry - but a reality TV jackpot sorted that out.

item.title: The codes helping visually-impaired people shop
item.description: New technology that allows phones to read out labelling is about to make supermarkets much more accessible.

item.title: Fire-and-rehire: What is it and why is it controversial?
item.description: Controversy surrounds companies which dismiss their workers and rehire them on worse contracts.

item.title: Lyme disease: 'People say I don't look ill'
item.description: Yen Lau describes her Lyme disease as an "invisible disease" that can cause days of sickness and fatigue.

item.title: Why are Chinese tech brands flocking to Euro 2020?
item.description: Four big Chinese firms have signed up to sponsor the European football tournament this year.

item.title: Parents of children called Alexa challenge Amazon
item.description: Youngsters are being bullied over their name - also the default wake word for the tech firm's smart speakers.

item.title: Euro 2020: 'My message to the England team - enjoy every minute of moments like this' - Alan Shearer
item.description: Former England captain and BBC Sport columnist Alan Shearer says the nation is behind the Three Lions, and their players should try to take everything in before Wednesday's Euro 2020 semi-final against Denmark.

item.title: ‘I’m going to have to do some laundry tonight’ – British teenager Raducanu into Wimbledon last 16
item.description: Emma Raducanu's dream debut run at Wimbledon continues into the fourth round with victory over Romania's world number 45 Sorana Cirstea.

item.title: England focus turns to Denmark semi-final after thrashing Ukraine
item.description: England will face Denmark in the Euro 2020 semi-finals on Wednesday, but what is the latest with tickets and how many will be able to watch at Wembley?

item.title: England into Euro 2020 semi-final: 'England fans transported to unfamiliar world'
item.description: Watching England is not meant to be like this, but Gareth Southgate has got fans believing, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: When in Rome... How players, pundits & fans reacted to England's incredible win
item.description: Relive the best action and reactions after England's incredible 4-0 victory over Ukraine in Rome to set up a Euro 2020 semi-final against Denmark at Wembley.

item.title: Ukraine v England pictures: Fans jubilant as Three Lions soar in Rome
item.description: Fans celebrate as England head for the Euro 2020 semi-finals after beating Ukraine.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ukraine 0-4 England - 'England want to go two steps further' says Gareth Southgate
item.description: England are not settling for a semi-final spot at Euro 2020 after they reach the last four by thrashing Ukraine, says Gareth Southgate.

item.title: Highlights: England thrash Ukraine to reach semi-finals
item.description: Watch highlights as Harry Kane's brace helped England cruise to victory beating Ukraine 4-0 to advance to the semi-finals of Euro 2020 against Denmark at Wembley.

item.title: England at Euro 2020: 'Something special is happening'
item.description: Former England captain Alan Shearer believes "something special is happening" as Gareth Southgate's side reach the Euro 2020 semi-finals.

item.title: England beat Ukraine: how social media reacted
item.description: England strolled into the semi-finals of Euro 2020 with a 4-0 win over Ukraine. Here's how it unfolded on social media.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ukraine v England - how you rated the players
item.description: How you rated the players in the Euro 2020 quarter-final between Ukraine and England.

item.title: Should we raucously celebrate a football win in a pandemic?
item.description: Scenes of England fans celebrating beating Germany have delighted many - but raised some eyebrows.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ukrainians unite over football after years of struggle
item.description: Hit by years of war and long months of Covid lockdown, Ukrainians dare to dream of football success.

item.title: When in Rome... The England fans at the match
item.description: England fans with tickets for Saturday's quarter-final tell us how they've managed to get there.

item.title: Euro 2020: England fan picks lucky shirt from 367-strip collection
item.description: Collector Pete Hammond dons his favourite three lions kit as the team prepares to face Ukraine.

item.title: England vs Ukraine: Euro 2020 quarter-final - what threat will Ukraine pose in Rome?
item.description: Will Andriy Shevchenko's Ukraine add to list of Euro 2020 shocks when they play England in their quarter-final in Rome on Saturday?

item.title: England v Ukraine at Euro 2020: How well do you remember previous Three Lions quarter-finals?
item.description: How much do you know about England's previous 12 quarter-finals at major tournaments? Take our quiz.

item.title: England v Ukraine: Three Lions' defence is perfect platform for Euro 2020 success - Rio Ferdinand
item.description: Former England defender and BBC Sport columnist Rio Ferdinand says the Three Lions' strength as a unit at the back has become their biggest strength as a team.

item.title: Karen Carney column: Experiencing Euro 2020 as a pitchside reporter
item.description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses what she has seen as a pitchside reporter at Euro 2020.

item.title: Covid: Will free school meals continue over summer holidays?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What are the social distancing rules and when could they end?
item.description: It's not clear whether we will still have to wear masks and socially distance once lockdown eases.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: There is 'no reason' for England's final Covid restrictions to last beyond 19 July, the government says.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,00 fans next week, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: The government says it's confident an Indian-made AZ vaccine used in the UK won't affect people's ability to travel abroad.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as almost 45 million people have received at least one dose.
